entry.title: üî¥ [New Scientist - Physics & Math] Star that seemed to vanish more than 130 years ago is found again

entry.content:

entry.title: üü† [Astrobiology] HKUST Launches World‚Äôs First Deep-sea Multi-omics Resource Platform Empowering Global Research Into Biological Adaptation In Extreme Environments
entry.summary: Announces a new Deep Ocean Omics (DOO) multi-omics database enabling global analysis of deep-sea extremophile biology and adaptation, offering useful context for astrobiology and environmental habitability studies but only indirect relevance to origins-of-life mechanisms.
entry.content:

entry.title: üî¥ [Astrobiology] Performance Calibration of the Wavefront Sensor‚Äôs EMCCD Detector for the Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph Aboard CSST
entry.summary: Technical calibration of an EMCCD detector for CSST‚Äôs coronagraph wavefront sensor, improving high-contrast exoplanet imaging capability but with no direct origins-of-life, habitability, or biosignature focus.
entry.content:
Category: KEYWORDS-ASTROBIOLOGY
Source: Astrobiology
Score: 35/100
AI Summary: Technical calibration of an EMCCD detector for CSST‚Äôs coronagraph wavefront sensor, improving high-contrast exoplanet imaging capability but with no direct origins-of-life, habitability, or biosignature focus.
Abstract:
The wavefront sensor (WFS), equipped with an electron-multiplying charge-coupled device (EMCCD) detector, is a critical component of the Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph (CPI-C) on the Chinese Space Station Telescope (CSST). Precise calibration of the WFS‚Äôs EMCCD detector is essential to meet the stringent requirements for high-contrast exoplanet imaging. This study comprehensively characterizes key performance parameters [‚Ä¶] The post Performance Calibration of the Wavefront Sensor‚Äôs EMCCD Detector for the Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph Aboard CSST appeared first on Astrobiology .

entry.title: üî¥ [Astrobiology] Observational Evidence For A Possible Link Between PAH Emission And Dust Trap Locations In Protoplanetary Disks
entry.summary: Compares PAH emission strengths across protoplanetary disks with ALMA dust-trap locations, suggesting a possible connection between PAH behavior (e.g., freeze-out) and dust concentrations relevant to early planet-forming environments.
entry.content:
Category: KEYWORDS-ASTROBIOLOGY
Source: Astrobiology
Score: 28/100
AI Summary: Compares PAH emission strengths across protoplanetary disks with ALMA dust-trap locations, suggesting a possible connection between PAH behavior (e.g., freeze-out) and dust concentrations relevant to early planet-forming environments.
Abstract:
Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons (PAHs) are commonly detected in protoplanetary disks, but it is unclear what causes the wide range of intensities across the samples. In this work, the measured PAH intensities of a range of disks are compared with ALMA dust continuum images, in order to test whether there is evidence that PAHs are frozen [‚Ä¶] The post Observational Evidence For A Possible Link Between PAH Emission And Dust Trap Locations In Protoplanetary Disks appeared first on Astrobiology .

entry.title: üî¥ [Astrobiology] Fungi From Chernobyl: Mycobiota Of The Inner Regions Of The Containment Structures Of The Damaged Nuclear Reactor
entry.summary: Survey of diverse fungi colonizing the high-radiation interior of Chernobyl‚Äôs damaged reactor containment, offering an astrobiology-relevant extremophile/habitability analog but limited direct relevance to origins-of-life mechanisms.
entry.content:
Category: KEYWORDS-ASTROBIOLOGY
Source: Astrobiology
Score: 35/100
AI Summary: Survey of diverse fungi colonizing the high-radiation interior of Chernobyl‚Äôs damaged reactor containment, offering an astrobiology-relevant extremophile/habitability analog but limited direct relevance to origins-of-life mechanisms.
Abstract:
Extensive fungal growth has been detected on the walls and other building constructions in the inner parts of the Shelter of the damaged fourth Unit of the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in 1997-98. The mycobiota comprised 37 species of 19 genera. Zygomycetes and ascomycetes were represented by one species each: Mucor plumbeus and Chaetomium globosum, [‚Ä¶] The post Fungi From Chernobyl: Mycobiota Of The Inner Regions Of The Containment Structures Of The Damaged Nuclear Reactor appeared first on Astrobiology .

entry.title: üî¥ [Astrobiology] Understanding Protein Form And Function Better At TU Graz
entry.summary: A structural-biology study aimed at better linking protein 3D form to function, which is broadly relevant to understanding biological complexity but not directly focused on prebiotic chemistry or origins-of-life mechanisms.
entry.content:
Category: KEYWORDS-ASTROBIOLOGY
Source: Astrobiology
Score: 25/100
AI Summary: A structural-biology study aimed at better linking protein 3D form to function, which is broadly relevant to understanding biological complexity but not directly focused on prebiotic chemistry or origins-of-life mechanisms.
Abstract:
Proteins are among the most important building blocks of nature and play a central role in biological processes in all organisms. Accordingly, scientists are keen to understand them as precisely as possible. As polymers of different amino acids, proteins can have different 3-dimensional structures and various functions. However, it is often difficult to determine which [‚Ä¶] The post Understanding Protein Form And Function Better At TU Graz appeared first on Astrobiology .

entry.summary: Discusses how ESA‚Äôs Comet Interceptor will select an as-yet-unknown long-period comet target, a mission concept relevant to astrobiology via access to primitive cometary material but not directly focused on origins-of-life chemistry.

AI Summary: Discusses how ESA‚Äôs Comet Interceptor will select an as-yet-unknown long-period comet target, a mission concept relevant to astrobiology via access to primitive cometary material but not directly focused on origins-of-life chemistry.
Abstract:
Comet Interceptor is an ESA science mission with payload contributions from ESA Member States and with an international participation by JAXA. It is the first mission that is being designed, built, and potentially launched before its target is known. This approach will enable the spacecraft to perform the first mission to a Long Period Comet [‚Ä¶] The post Considerations On The Process Of Target Selection For The Comet Interceptor Mission appeared first on Astrobiology .

entry.title: üü† [Astrobiology] Curiosity Mars Rover Views A Rock Made Of Sulfur At Snow Lake
entry.summary: Curiosity imaged and analyzed sulfur-bearing rocks at ‚ÄúSnow Lake‚Äù on Mars, highlighting geochemical conditions that could inform past habitability but offering limited direct insight into origins-of-life mechanisms.
entry.content:

Source: Astrobiology
Score: 50/100
AI Summary: Curiosity imaged and analyzed sulfur-bearing rocks at ‚ÄúSnow Lake‚Äù on Mars, highlighting geochemical conditions that could inform past habitability but offering limited direct insight into origins-of-life mechanisms.
Abstract:
NASA‚Äôs Curiosity captured this close-up image of a rock nicknamed ‚ÄúSnow Lake‚Äù on June 8, 2024, the 4,209th Martian day, or sol, of the mission. Nine days earlier, the rover had crushed a similar-looking rock and revealed crystalline textures ‚Äî and elemental sulfur ‚Äî inside.
